intro: Ornithogalum oxypetalum, commonly known as the white star lily, is a bulbous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of star-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy blooms that appear in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
